diagnosis.final_diagnosis: Mild form of Jansen's metaphyseal chondrodysplasia (JMC) caused by a novel PTH/PTHrP receptor mutation (T410R)
diagnosis.diagnostic_reasoning: The combination of clinical, biochemical, and radiological findings was consistent with a mild form of JMC, including skeletal dysplasia, normal stature with slight height below the third percentile, and elevated urinary calcium excretion despite normal serum calcium and PTH levels.
